definitions.definition: The back side of anything , the part opposite its front , particularly :

subdefinitions.definition: The back side of an estate : the backyard and outbuildings behind a main house , especially ( UK dialect , euphemistic ) an outhouse .
examples: The building's backside faced an alley and was covered in grime and graffiti.
Having ridden the horse all day for the first time, I had painful blisters on my backside .

subdefinitions.definition: The back side of a page : a verso .

definitions.definition: The reverse or opposite of anything .
Used other than figuratively or idiomatically: see back ,‎ side .

main_definition: The back side of anything , the part opposite its front , particularly :
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively ) The reverse or opposite of anything .
Used other than figuratively or idiomatically: see back ,‎ side .
